page.title: 01CRUWYS MORCHARD-INTRODUCTION
page.content: { {This survey covers the northern part {of the parish of Cruwys Morchard in {mid-Devon. It is equi-distant from the {Atlantic and the English Channel {coasts. The rounded outline of Exmoor {to the north contrasts with Dartmoor's {craggy tors to the south. Lying either {side of the A373 the area consists of {a plateau 228-244m above sea level, {falling away in steep-sided valleys. {Shallow streams rise on this watershed {and join tributaries of the Exe and {the Taw. {At the centre of this rural area, the {Church, Manor House and Parish Hall {stand alone, with most of the {population living in isolated farms {and the small hamlet of Pennymoor. {The small fields and patches {of woodland give a green pastoral {landscape under wide skies.
